info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 01 at 12:57PM EDT until April 01 at 1:45PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pittsburgh has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Harrison County in east central Ohio... Jefferson County in east central Ohio... Columbiana County in east central Ohio... Carroll County in east central Ohio... Northwestern Belmont County in east central Ohio... Mercer County in northwestern Pennsylvania... Beaver County in western Pennsylvania... Lawrence County in western Pennsylvania... Brooke County in northern West Virginia... Hancock County in northern West Virginia... * Until 145 PM EDT. * At 1256 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles south of Burton to 6 miles west of Cadiz, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. * Locations impacted include... Cranberry, New Castle, Weirton, Steubenville, Hermitage, Sharon, Salem, East Liverpool, Aliquippa, Beaver Falls, Columbiana, and Monaca. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 1 and 25. Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 112 and 137. Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 19. Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 49. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
